messages.content: What should I learn to create realtime CGI with 3D characters?

To create real-time CGI with 3D characters, you will need to learn a variety of skills, including:

3D modeling, animation, and rigging
Real-time rendering with advanced shaders and lighting effects
Scripting and programming in a 3D environment
Communication and collaboration with other artists and team members
These skills can be learned through online courses, tutorials, and workshops, as well as through hands-on experience with 3D software and tools. It is also important to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the field and to seek guidance from experienced professionals.
How do I become a Vtuber?

To become a YouTuber, you will need to have a passion for creating and sharing videos, a steady stream of subscribers, and the technical know-how to produce and edit videos. Here are some steps you can follow to become a successful YouTuber:

Define your niche: Choose a topic or area of focus that you are passionate about and that you can consistently produce content about. This will help you build a loyal audience and create a unique brand.

Set up a studio: If you don't already have a studio, you will need to purchase or build one to store your equipment, set up lighting, and create a space for recording and editing your videos.

Create a content schedule: Decide on a schedule for creating and publishing your videos, and stick to it. This will help you stay organized and motivated.

Promote your videos: Use social media, email marketing, and other tactics to promote your videos and grow your audience.

Edit and refine your videos: Invest time in editing and refining your videos, to make them as engaging and professional-looking as possible.

Collaborate with other creators: Consider collaborating with other creators to spread your reach and build your audience.

Engage with your audience: Respond to comments and questions from your viewers, and use social media to interact with your followers.

Stay consistent: The key to success as a YouTuber is consistency. Build your skills, create quality content, and stay committed to your channel over time.

Keep learning: As you build your channel, don't be afraid to experiment and try new things. The more you learn, the more you can create unique and engaging content that resonates with your audience.
What is the "cross-platform" analog of CUDA and ROCm?

GPU accelerated computing or GPU Compute is a subset of machine learning that enables GPUs to perform large computations that would normally be limited by the processing power of a CPU.

The equivalent of CUDA and ROCm on other platforms would be the "cross-platform" analogy of GPU Compute, which is a subset of machine learning that enables GPUs to perform large computations that would normally be limited by the processing power of a CPU on other platforms.

Cross-platform GPU Compute frameworks such as TensorFlow Lite, Caffe2, and PyTorch offer a way to use GPUs on multiple platforms, including mobile devices, desktops, and servers, without having to write separate code for each platform.

These frameworks use programming languages such as Python, C++, and Java to perform GPU computations on the GPU, and can be integrated with other libraries and tools to optimize the performance of machine learning models.

Cross-platform GPU Compute is a powerful tool that can help to accelerate the development of machine learning applications on a wide range of platforms, and can be a key enabler for building smart and efficient systems that can learn from data and make decisions in real time.
